Entries.default: The roar of the arena quiets to a hollow drone as the glowing outline of an aumaua congeals before you.
"Congratulations, mighty Watcher."
"And the chosen of the other Faces of the Hunt. I assume they are next?"
"That's it? I was hoping for more."
"Perhaps a moment of silence for the other contenders is in order."
"You aren't required to kill them all, but you must outlive them."
"I'm ready for whatever's next."
"Is there some sort of power struggle between you and the other Faces of the Hunt?"
"How many more must die before the Crucible decides I'm worthy?"
"What if I fail to become champion?"
"Toamowhai favors the prepared, but he preys on those who feel they've left nothing to chance."
"Good luck, my chosen kin. Learn from that which fails to kill you, then feast on its carcass."
"Then the tougher kith will be Champion of the Hunt while you feed the chum pools beneath the Crucible."
"The souls of the Crucible will sing to the champion, but unless that champion is you, the winner will hear little of their song."
"Yes, an ancient struggle for honor - and for bragging rights."
"If we did not struggle, we would not be worshipping Toamowhai."
"You need not kill anyone, but I doubt your rivals will slay themselves on your behalf."
"Endure the other Faces' chosen, and you will be crowned Champion of the Hunt."
"And you shall have it. There will always be challengers eager for the chance to kill you."

"Let us pray for those who perished - so that you might survive."

The soul bows their head in quiet contemplation.
[Say nothing.]
"You have outlived all who would claim your victory."
"In the rush to celebrate the hunt, the hunted is oft forgotten. I am glad that you do not."
"Only one battle stands between you and the champion's mantle. You will fight the other Faces' chosen in one grand melee."
"Once fully in tune with it, the Crucible will hide nothing from your Watcher's senses."

"Besides, how else are the people to know which aspect of Toamowhai is the truest expression of his majesty?"

The figure chuckles quietly.
"But you are the only Watcher among the contenders."
"That was a half-truth. You're keeping something from me."
The Surviving Face sighs, deflating slightly.
"The other Faces do not want what I want. I would not speak for them beyond that."
"To hear them, to save them, to preserve Kazuwari, you must claim the championship."
"What if Kazuwari shouldn't endure?"
Shaking their head, the figure frowns.
"Then it will not."
"Who were you, before you became the Surviving Face?"
"A tough old Huana." The figure chuckles quietly.
"It was a very long time ago. I remember little save endless struggle upon a sea of mad chaos."
